A Web Service Framework typically consists of several components which can be broken down into layers. The most common structure includes an application layer, business logic layer, data access layer, and database.

The Application Layer contains interfaces for users to interact with the system such as authentication, request/response handling, etc. It also provides abstraction between different clients and services.

The Business Logic Layer enforces rules and regulations defined by the organization while providing access to relevant data from the Data Access Layer. This layer should contain all decision-making processes related to user input.

The Data AccessLayer handles retrieving and manipulating information stored within the Database. This could involve querying the database or simply accessing existing records.
